Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CEM1 (Pexiganan fragment, synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, amphibians, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 54.55% similar toPexigananK: 42%, F=G: 17%.Chemical modification: C-terminal amidation.Activity: active against S.aureus ATCC 25923 or ATCC 33591 MRSA (MIC 512 ug/ml or greater), S. epidermidis  ATCC 35984 (MIC 32-64 ug/ml), and P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 4-8 ug/ml).SAR: A series of 12-mer scanning sequence truncation was conducted based on MSI-78. All the truncated 12mers lost activity against Gram+ MRSA (MIC 128->512 ug/ml) due to reduced hydrophobicity. Only CEM1 retained good activity against P. aeruginosa.In vitro toxicity: CEM1 is not hemo.lytic even at 512 ug/ml.Structure:  RANDOM COIL IN buffer and helical in DMPG vesicles.
Literature Information.Author: Monteiro C, Fernandes M, Pinheiro M, Maia S, Seabra CL, Ferreira-da-Silva F, Costa F, Reis S, Gomes P, Martins MC. 2015
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial properties of membrane-active dodecapeptides derived from MSI-78.
